Fsm
Class FSM

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Fsm.FSM
public class FSM
extends java.lang.Object

An FSM consists of a set of Transistions, a starting State, and a current State. Events are passed into the FSM using the doEvent() method. The FSM handles an Event as follows:

(1) Locate the Transition that matches the current State and Event (See the Transition class)

(2) If no matching Transition is found, throw an FsmException.

(3) If a matching Transition is found, then set the current State to the next State defined for this Transition and execute the Action defined for this Transition. The FSM object and Event are passed to the Action.execute() method

See Also:
Transition, Event, State, Action

addTransition

public void addTransition(Transition t)
                   throws FsmException
Add a Transition to this FSM. The Transition must be one that has not yet been defined. Transitions are identified by the pair: current State and Event.
Parameters:
t - the Transition to add.

doEvent

public void doEvent(Event e)
             throws FsmException
Pass an Event into the FSM. The FSM current State and the input Event are used to identify the Transition to execute. If a valid Transition is defined, the curent State is set to the Transition's next State, and the Transition's Action is executed.
Parameters:
e - The Event to pass into the FSM
See Also:
Transition

traceOn

public void traceOn()
Enable FSM trace operations

traceOff

public void traceOff()
Disable FSM trace operations
